name: fuckyoufriday
text: I really appreciate Nice Pete's philosophy of music.

name: spinynorman
text: His idea of music is so goddamn weird. Singing is a task, the act of playing brings on a pleasurable stress, and he feels the need to specify that the type of band they will form will be a "music band." Like they were going to be a band of merry, good-hearted thieves alternately.

name: norsef
text: I guess band has a different connotation in prison.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Good Music played well by men is something we need more of in the world. Music that everyone can dig and just get together to have a good time with. Not pop, not rock, not jazz, not rap, just . . . music.

name: greenkoolayd
text: we have enough dudes making music.  we need more chick-rock.  that doesnt suck.

name: snachicat
text: the problem with this is that chick-rock sucks.

name: greenkoolayd
text: rock for chicks? or rock created by chicks?

name: mockereo
text:
both.

where is your head at dog? that one was obvious.

name: soticoto
text: Chick-metal, on the other hand, is the best kind.

name: overmedicated
text: There should be more music out there played well, by men.

name: nyu
text: A comment left by nyu was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Gulik, riotdejaneiro, sevenarts, Gompo, tttt2, ketamind, ravindra108, Archon_Divinus, wehavemagnums)

name: unfun
text: Hanson were all underage and the Backstreet Boys have "Boys" in their name.  These were not men.

name: tekende
text: Also, they were not playing the music, but merely performing choreographed karaoke.

name: neaner
text: Let's not forget The Monkees, here.

name: wittyname
text: Lamed by mistake, though I can't think why someone wuld give the other lame.

name: farqussus
text: Maybe someone's brother was in the Backstreet Boys, and maybe someone's very, very proud of his achievements <sob> ...

name: tttt2
text: Backstreet Boys/Hanson ripping in 2007 is a bit passe, I'd say

name: pogo
text: NO, these insults to music by men must not be forgotten -- the CDs (and tapes in Africa) still exist.

name: steev_dayv
text: True.  Just because their suck was a part of our past as a culture doesn't make it suck any less.  It's like being taunted for peeing your pants in grade school.  You can't outrun that shit.

name: selbencoirlo
text: It is, indeed, impossible to outrun peeing in your pants. All it accomplishes is leaving a long glistening trail of urine across the playground blacktop.

name: gunsofray
text: And eventually it gets so ba you have to become a hermit.

name: steev_dayv
text: AT first glance, your avicon looks like dicks in butts...

name: gunsofray
text: it isn't dicks in butts, its penises in vaginas. Or should that be 'peni in vaginae'? Either way, its a painting called Penis Landscape

name: steev_dayv
text: I can appreciate that.

name: skavid
text: Chubbied for H.R. Giger.

name: steev_dayv
text: This was his worst piece.  It shows so little of his talent.

name: smallberries
text: It was sufficiently talented to warrant a raid on Jello Biafra's home then a lengthy & expensive court battle to determine whether the work in question created "prurient interests" i.e. whether someone, somewhere got his or her chubby on while viewing it. A special thanks to Tipper Gore's PMRC (acronym for Bouffant Encrusted Thought-Police). Oh does the name sound familiar? It's Al's wife!

name: bixschmix
text: Boyz II Men, however, successfully completed the transition.

name: mystkmanat
text: My feelings on your avataricon: Pro.

name: waddlerz
text: Also, it wasn't really music either

name: greenkoolayd
text: hanson wrote thier own music.  on instruments.  i guve them respect for that, even if i dont particularly enjoy the specific sounds they created.

name: the_voice
text: Husker Du.

name: pants
text: A comment left by pants was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, ButterMoths, riotdejaneiro, HassanOLeary, Overmedicated, Jesler729, NYU, pa_ass_nts, GMM, farqussus, tehloki, Lumus, Magb, mystkmanat, ravindra108, Tragic_Johnson, magnificentpoof, ford, yaegmenthor, Mastronaut, wehavemagnums)

name: overmedicated
text: Achewood > lol

name: spinynorman
text: The detail in Nice Pete's hand in the third panel really adds a lot of creepy, creepy expression to him. There's something feminine about how he thoughtfully holds the pencil to his lips that I just... don't... like.

name: soticoto
text: There is something low and base about typing "lol" that is totally beneath Achewood.

name: achilleselbow
text: It shows that you are of low mind.

name: glyphtheory
text: This is why I choose to read the overmedicated comment as a statement of 'Achewood' is greater than 'lol'. That is acceptable.

name: stayawaystars
text: for someone with no pupils, Lyle certainly has very expressive eyes in this one

name: mastronaut
text:
I love the idea that Lyle doesnt actually SAY anything past panel 2, and just sits there while Pete explains and responds to imaginary questions.

"What? No, there is not a particular style such as blues or heavy metal."

name: jesler729
text: I'm not sure if it was intended that way, but you're right, the idea is great.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Once I thought of it, I liked to assume Lyle has asked the question and suggested the two example styles, as the idea that Nice Pete is repeating them when answering is hilarious.

name: tekende
text: I too enjoy this interpretation and shall accept it as canon.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Also, his bottle of Jack might as well be a million miles away. It is of no help in this conversation.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: He grows pupils when Nice Pete calls.

name: catachresis
text: Fuckin' love this arc

name: nurdbot
text: Me too. 'It will just be good music, played well by men!' is such an epic damn quote.

name: epicurus
text: Nice Pete's understanding of music is very awesome. Notice he sees no problem with them forming a band this afternoon, then playing at a concert tonight.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
do not forget that the people will go crazy.

and there will be many, many people looking at him.

name: mega_panda
text: I generally find that my pupils, regardless of my emotional state, tend to remain saucer shaped

name: lawdog
text: Is it wrong that I keep looking for a secret code in Pete's chest hair?

name: pa_ass_nts
text: It is a Bad Thing that Men should not do. It is not OK.

name: achilleselbow
text: Do you also think it is wrong for a man to give another man kisses?

name: mugi
text: No, I agree that it is okay.

name: tekende
text: As long as that other man isn't me, I don't care.

name: purplehaze
text: Can the first man be you?

name: teknofatcat
text: A comment left by teknofatcat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stopeatingmyeyes, envika, Zem)

name: stuart
text: This is a totally unsuspicious proposition from a convicted murderer

name: cheeks_jd
text: I hate Pete's pose on the phone when he has the pencil in his mouth. Every strip where he is on the phone he does that pose. I guess I just think it doesn't suit him.

name: lunchbox
text: Chris Onstad should be praised for his apparent affinity for Rickenbackers. They are great guitars and perfect basses.

name: tttt2
text:
I know Nice Pete is American but it's impossible to picture him talking with anything other than Vlad's accent

also, the world would be a better place if the music industry worked that way

name: jackparsons
text: The only appropriate accent is the weird faux-british accent of teenage thugs nationwide, as in the thug kid in The Simpsons. This does not work with Nice Pete. He would have the blank affectless monotone of a bored news announcer.

name: charchar
text: I hear it as a mid-pitched breathy rasp, very crisply enunciated.  I don't know how to explain it, and the internet isn't helping.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: like the descriptions of behavior in both Men In Black or the G-Man from Halflife ?

name: boredom_man
text: I hear my father's voice.

name: tekende
text:
I still hear it as sounding kind of like that gay mustached dude from Family Guy who shows up in a variety of different occupations and situations.

Although I was thinking about Achewood voices not long ago and thought that Phillip Seymour Hoffman would make a good choice for Nice Pete.

Also:
Roast Beef - Steve Buscemi
Todd - Tracy Morgan

I think that was about as far as I got.

name: theguitarhero
text: "F-f-fuck man, that b-b-bird b-b-better not fuck up my credit!"

name: dak
text: I wonder if "Mister Band" was out of his own mind or whether he's heard of "Mr.Children".

name: tekende
text: Or Mister Mister.

name: doc_rostov
text:
This one is wonderful.

All that a music band really needs is a good, honest name that people can believe in. Oh, and music played well by men. Aw, Nice Pete. Such a dreamer.

name: godfatherofsouls
text: These two should hang out more.

name: saru
text: If I ever start a band, I'm telling everyone the genre is music-core. It will be good music, played by men.

name: wartooth
text:
i know, i love how the genre for mister band is music-core, we used to come up with these all the time, my favorites:
horse-core, so tuff you dont use cars anymore
and
apple-core, so stupid it needs no explanation

name: theguitarhero
text: I totally wish Music-core was a choice on the drop down menu on Myspace.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Music-core has very much entered, if not my actual speech very often, definitely my thought processes.  It's just such a helpful way to think of what one is doing while writing music.

name: c_dizzle
text: Why - out of all the Nice Pete strips - does this creep me out the most?

name: woodenteeth
text: For me it kinda demonstrates that if a fucked up serial killer calls you with a fucked up idea about starting a band even someone as hard as Lyle just has to stand there and listen and become involved, you do not say no to Nice Pete.

name: epicurus
text: Lyle's expression in panel 6 is pretty close to perfect. How do people who know Nice Pete deal with this shit?

name: drskradley
text: I 5'd this purely because of that very expression.

name: hardelicious
text: The last panel describes exactly the idea behind "American Idol" if you take out the third sentence.

name: ricnine
text: Read Nice Pete's part in your head as Christopher Walken and tell me it isn't a PERFECT fit. Or better yet, don't tell me that because you will be making a liar of yourself and that is the saddest thing.

name: tekende
text: I have to disagree with you. I am sorry about this ricnine.

name: bjorntd
text: I can't help but see Nice Pete's ears as horns instead of ears. It must be the hair.

name: cbtbone
text: I'm not sure if Lyle is supposed to have actually asked Nice Pete what style of music the band will play, but I like it better if he doesn't, and Pete just supplies the answer.  Or perhaps answers a voice in his head.

name: g-money
text: L@@K at his hand in panel three.
